title: â€˜The Witcherâ€™ Season 4 Is an Upgrade as Liam Hemsworth Takes Over From Henry Cavill: TV Review
description: Based on the popular book series by Andrzej Sapkowski and adapted for television by Lauren Schmidt Hissrich, â€œThe Witcherâ€ has returned to Netflix f
body:
Based on the popular book series by Andrzej Sapkowski and adapted for television by Lauren Schmidt Hissrich, â€œThe Witcherâ€ has returned to Netflix for its fourth and penultimate season. This time,Â Liam HemsworthÂ is stepping into Henry Cavillâ€™s shoes to portray the silver-haired monster-slaying witcher, Geralt of Rivia â€” Cavill left the series in 2022 after Season 3, anÂ announcement that was made simultaneousÂ to Hemsworth taking over the role.. In a much sharper and less convoluted season than the previous one, â€œThe Witcherâ€ Season 4 is action-packed and full of dazzling characters both old and new. It acts as a reset, ironing out the confusing conflicts and plot points that have long plagued the series.Â 
	

	â€œThe Witcherâ€ Season 4 opens with an old man reading the story of The Butcher of Blaviken. A century in the future of the showâ€™s chronology, the man tells a group of eager young children about the legend of Geralt of Rivia. This opening sequence recaps the events of the first three seasons and grounds the audience in the epicâ€™s current timeline. Separated from his lover, Yennefer (Anya Chalotra) and his adoptive daughter, Ciri (Freya Allan), Geralt has been severely injured by the evil mage Vilgefortz (Mahesh Jadu). Still struggling to walk on his battered knee, he, along with his best friend, Jaskier the bard (Joey Batey) and the legendary archer Milva (Mengâ€™er Zhang), are embarking on their quest to find Ciri before Vilgefortz or Emhyr (Bart Edwards), the emperor of Nilfgaard, gets a hold of her. During this adventure, Geralt eventually becomes allies with a crew that â€œWitcherâ€ book lovers will recognize as the Hanza. On the opposite side of the war-tornÂ Continent, Yennefer has begun recruiting her fellow mages, including Philippa (Cassie Claire), Francesca (Mecia Simson), and Fringilla (MimÃ® M. Khayisa), to Aretuza in an effort to begin crafting plans to try and take down the increasingly powerful Vilgefortz.Â 
	

	For her part, Ciri, now in her twenties, is exhausted by her legacy. Her powerful Elder blood and Nilfgaard lineage have made her a coveted commodity for some of the most powerful people on the Continent. As a result, she has shed her identity and powers. She has found refuge among a ragtag band of thieves â€” the Rats â€” under the new identity, Falka. As young people tend to do, viewers see Ciri trying to define herself outside her parentsâ€™ shadows. Still, she struggles to understand and adhere to the Ratsâ€™ precarious moral code. Without Geralt and Yenneferâ€™s direct guidance, Ciri tries to define her future for herself. Yet, what she comes to understand is that no matter how far she tries to run from her past, destiny has a way of catching up to her.Â 

	Most fans of the show have likely been bracing themselves to see how Hemsworth takes on a character Cavill has long mastered. Although the voice isnâ€™t quite the same, as the episodes move forward and given the seasonâ€™s straightforward structure, which zeros in on Geralt, Yennefer and Ciri separately, the transition is mostly seamless. Moreover, as the stoic monster hunter has become increasingly attuned to his own emotions, the distinct difference between the two actors makes even more sense, given Geraltâ€™s slightly more emotive nature in the storyâ€™s current timeframe.Â 

	In addition, the gorgeously shot action sequences, full of magic, sword-wielding, beheadings and, of course, an array of monsters, are complemented by several new characters who also make their distinct mark on this robust, fully rendered universe. Over the eight-episode season, fans are introduced to Regis (Laurence Fishburne), a mysterious herbalist who aids Geralt and his gang during a desperate time of need. Additionally, there is Zoltan (Danny Woodburn), the fan-favorite dwarf with some rather thrilling skills, and several others to round out the already expansive cast.Â 

	Overall, even as a brand-new lead takes the charge, â€œThe Witcherâ€ Season 4 has mostly reclaimed its magic. Though Episode 5, â€œThe Joy of Cooking,â€ acts as a filler chapter rather than an actual narrative, the rest of the season is well-paced, tonally on point and offers ample screen time to the leading trio, interweaving the immense fable in a way that is accessible and interesting instead of overstuffed and exhausting. Though Season 4 is not the final chapter of â€œThe Witcher,â€ itâ€™s an essential building block for what is to be a fifth and final swing at this extravagantly told medieval tale. â€œThe Witcherâ€ is coming to a close, but in many ways, this feels like the beginning.
	

	â€œThe Witcherâ€ Season 4 is now available to stream onÂ Netflix.Â

schema.headline: â€˜The Witcherâ€™ Season 4 Is an Upgrade as Liam Hemsworth Takes Over From Henry Cavill: TV Review

title: â€˜One Pieceâ€™ Producer Tetsu Fujimura Says Japanâ€™s IP Wave Is Going Global
description: Tetsu Fujimuraâ€™s keynote talk The Future of Japanese Intellectual Property in Global Adaptations offered TIFFCOM attendees a convincing argument tha
body:
Tetsu Fujimuraâ€™s keynote talk The Future of Japanese Intellectual Property in Global Adaptations offered TIFFCOM attendees a convincing argument that Japanese IP is quickly becoming one of the countryâ€™s core industries, rivalling even its mighty car manufacturers.

	TIFFCOM is the market arm of the Tokyo International Film Festival. 

	The founder and CEO of consulting firm Filosophia, as well as the founder of major distributor Gaga Corporation, Fujimura began the talk with a brisk run through of his rise to a leading producer of Japan-generated content for a world audience, including the hit Netflix live-action â€œOne Pieceâ€ series.
	

	Key to his success, he explained, were connections with top-tier Hollywood producers, beginning with Marvel Studio founder Avi Arad, with whom he produced the 2017 live-action sci-fi â€œGhost in the Shell,â€ and TV producer Marty Adelstein, who became his partner in making â€œOne Piece.â€


	But his individual achievements, as he illustrated with a blizzard of meticulously researched facts and figures, form only one wave of growing tsunami of Japanese IP, from manga and anime to movies and games, that is advancing into the global marketplace.

	This tsunami has been a long time in building, from the 1990s when only about 10 or 20% of the top 30 films at the global box office were based on existing IP, to approaching 90 percent in the current decade.

	Of the top 20 titles in the most current IP revenue rankings, compiled in 2021, ten are Japanese, including â€˜Pokemon,â€™ â€˜Hello Kitty,â€™ â€˜Anpanman,â€™ â€˜Super Mario,â€™ â€˜Shonen Jump,â€™ â€˜Gundam,â€™ â€˜Dragon Ball,â€™ â€˜Fist of the North Star,â€™ â€˜One Pieceâ€™ and â€˜Yu-Gi-Oh!.â€™ â€œIn these kinds of global rankings, Japanese works inevitably appear in large numbers,â€ Fujimura commented. â€œSo I think you understand that Japan occupies a significant presence in the world in many ways.â€
	

	What makes Japanese IP so strong? Fujimura listed three reasons: Japanâ€™s massive appetite for manga and anime, fueled by major publishers, TV broadcasters and animation studio; the global distribution of anime, with Netflix and Amazon leading the way; and Japanâ€™s rank as one of the worldâ€™s leading gaming powers, with Sony (â€œUncharted,â€ â€œGran Turismoâ€) and Nintendo (â€œSonic the Hedgehog,â€ â€œSuper Marioâ€) not only leading the pack but generating hit films from their games.

	â€œAmong game originals adapted into Hollywood live-action films Japanese IPs are currently the most numerous,â€ Fujimura said. â€œI believe they will attract even more attention going forward.â€

	One example is the 2023 â€œThe Super Mario Bros. Movieâ€ which grossed $1.361 billion worldwide making it the fifth highest earning animation of all time. â€œDisney has produced countless animated films, and this outranks all of them but â€˜Frozen 2,â€™â€ Fujimura said. â€œWhat itâ€™s achieved is incredible and really shows just how powerful Japanese animation is.â€

	His conclusion: â€œJapanâ€™s representative IP genres â€“ manga, anime, and games â€“ possess extremely high growth potential that I believe will continue to be a source of pride. Itâ€™s a testament to Japanâ€™s strength, proving that Japanese IPs can succeed in Hollywood.â€

schema.headline: â€˜One Pieceâ€™ Producer Tetsu Fujimura Says Japanâ€™s IP Wave Is Going Global

title: Japanâ€™s Anime Market Hits Record $25 Billion, Driven by Global Boom, AJA Report Finds
description: Japanâ€™s anime industry reached an all-time high in 2024, climbing to JPY3.84 trillion ($25.25 billion) in total market value, according to data pres
body:
Japanâ€™s anime industry reached an all-time high in 2024, climbing to JPY3.84 trillion ($25.25 billion) in total market value, according to data presented by the Association of Japanese Animations (AJA) at TIFFCOM, the market arm of the Tokyo International Film Festival.

	The session, which also featured presentations by â€œGodzillaâ€ studio Toho Global on its international strategy, the â€œGundamâ€ franchise, and Annecy-winning feature â€œChaOâ€ â€” which is also screening at the Tokyo festival â€” underscored how anime continues to drive Japanâ€™s expanding global content economy.
	

	Overseas revenues surged 26% year-on-year to JPY2.17 trillion ($14.27 billion), while local earnings rose 2.8% to JPY1.67 trillion ($10.98 billion). This marks the second-highest annual growth rate on record after 2019â€™s 15.3% increase.


	AJA chair Kazuko Ishikawa, who is also president of Nippon Animation, said anime has become a core pillar of Japanâ€™s cultural and economic exports. She added that the association aims to further improve industry conditions so that creators and studios can continue producing high-quality works that resonate with audiences worldwide.

	The upcoming Anime Industry Report 2025, set for publication in December, divides the market into two key sectors: the broad â€œanime industry market,â€ which estimates total consumer spending across anime-related goods and licensing, and the narrower â€œanime production market,â€ which tracks studio revenues.

	The production-side market also set a record in 2024, rising 9.1% year-on-year to JPY466.2 billion ($3.06 billion). Overseas business contributed JPY118.8 billion ($781 million) â€” still a smaller share overall, but growing steadily year by year.
	

	â€œThe overseas market now far exceeds local revenues, and the gap will only widen,â€ said Masahiko Hasegawa, editor-in-chief of the AJA report. â€œGrowth today includes bundled contracts that span theatrical, streaming, merchandising, and event rights â€” not just content distribution.â€

	AJA data indicates that overseas anime revenues overtook domestic earnings in 2023 for the first time since the pandemic, and that the gap widened dramatically in 2024. The International Otaku Events Association now lists 136 anime-related events in 51 countries and regions, reinforcing the genreâ€™s global momentum.

	Japanâ€™s government continues to position anime and related media â€” including film, games, manga, and music â€” as a strategic core industry. Under its revised Cool Japan initiative, the national goal is to triple overseas content sales to JPY20 trillion ($131.4 billion) by 2033, from approximately JPY5.8 trillion ($38 billion) in 2024.

	AJA forecasts that future growth will not only come from distribution and theatrical revenues but from exporting Japanâ€™s entire anime ecosystem, including merchandise tie-ins, retail campaigns, and cross-media collaborations.

	â€œAnime is no longer just storytelling,â€ said Hasegawa. â€œItâ€™s a full cultural economy â€” and that economy is rapidly going global.â€

schema.headline: Japanâ€™s Anime Market Hits Record $25 Billion, Driven by Global Boom, AJA Report Finds

title: Comcast Sees Q3 Profit Drop, Facing Comparisons With 2024 Olympics, Cord Cutting
description: Comcast said third-quarter profit dropped as the media-and-cable conglomerate continued to grapple with cord cutting in its flagship content distrib
body:
Comcast said third-quarter profit dropped as the media-and-cable conglomerate continued to grapple with cord cutting in its flagship content distribution business and faced comparisons with last yearâ€™s Paris Olympics, when the company generated $1.9 billion in extra revenue. 

	The Philadelphia company said it lost 104,000 domestic broadband customers during the period, bringing its total subscriber base to roughly 31.4 million â€” the fourth consecutive quarter of subscriber losses in this key business area. It also lost 257,000 pay TV subscribers. Revenue tied to its media operations which include NBCUniversal, came to $6.6 billion, a drop of  almost 20%. Without taking the 2024 Paris Olympics into account, revenue rose 4% over the year-earlier period, Comcast said.
	

	Net income attributable to Comcast fell 8% to $3.33 billion, or 90 cents per share, compared with $3.63 billion, or 94 cents per share, in the year-earlier quarter. The companyâ€™s results beat Wall Streetâ€™s estimate for the period.


	Comcast said it continued to emphasize sales of mobile service, and added 414,000 mobile customers in the third quarter â€” a record number for the company. 

	In a statement, Comcast CEO Brian Roberts pointed to the mobile gains as well as a growing focus on sports at NBCUniversal, which he said would create new interest in the companyâ€™s TV networks and Peacock streaming service. â€œWeâ€™re building momentum across NBC and Peacock as we head into one of the most exciting stretches of live sports in our history, including robust NBA coverage which just began last week,â€ he said in a statement, adding: â€œWe generated $4.9 billion of free cash flow this quarter and $14.9 billion year-to-date despite significant investment weâ€™re making in repositioning our company, a testament to both the durability and resilience of our underlying business.â€
	

	Peacock, which is still in its early days, boasted 41 million subscribers as of Sept. 30,  close to flat with results from the rest of the year. Comcast said the streaming service lost $217 million in the third quarter, narrowing losses from $436 million in the year-earlier period.

	The company found bright spots in its film and theme park operations. Movie revenue rose 6% to $3 billion, thanks in part to the release of â€œJurassic World Rebirthâ€ in July.Â Revenue from theme parks rose nearly 19% to $2.72 billion, due in part to the May opening of the new Epic Universe.

schema.headline: Comcast Sees Q3 Profit Drop, Facing Comparisons With 2024 Olympics, Cord Cutting

title: Fox Sees Q1 Revenue Grow, But Higher Expenses Cut Profit
description: Fox Corporation said profit in its first fiscal quarter fell due to higher operating expenses, even as overall revenue rose 5% or $174 million, tied
body:
Fox Corporation said profit in its first fiscal quarter fell due to higher operating expenses, even as overall revenue rose 5% or $174 million, tied to increased cash from advertising and distribution.

	The owner of Fox News Channel, Fox Sports and the Fox broadcasting network said net income attributable top shareholders came to $599 million, or $1.32 per share, compared with $827 million, or $1.78 per share, in the year-earlier period. Adjusted for one-time items, first quarter profit came toÂ $1.51Â per share. The company also said its Tubi ad-supported streaming service became profitable in the quarter, faster than previously anticipated.
	

	Fox said it saw higher expenses during the period tied to increases in digital marketing and content costs and entertainment programming rights amortization.


	â€œWe are delivering for audiences with continued engagement growth across the portfolio which underpins the robust advertising demand we are seeing across sports, news, entertainment and Tubi,â€ said Fox CEO Lachlan Murdoch, in a statement.

	Fox has thrived during a difficult period for media companies by focusing largely on news and sports, two TV formats that continue to attract the large, live audiences that advertisers crave When it comes to streaming, Fox has focused the bulk of its resources on Tubi, which is free and ad-supported and has not required the billions of dollars for new, premium content that subscription-based rivals have. Fox earlier this year launched a subscription streamer, Fox One, that features the programming it offers on its TV networks â€” but for cord-cutters who do not have a subscription to a cable or satellite service.
	

	Fox said revenue rose 4%, or $65 million, from its cable operations, with distribution revenue up 3%, to $28 million. Advertising revenue rose 7%, or $24 million, due to higher prices for news programming. 

	The companyâ€™s linear TV operations saw revenue rise 5% ,or $97 million. Advertising revenue rose 6%, or $59 million, tied to Tubi and the NFL. Distribution revenue rose $15 million or 2%.

	More to comeâ€¦.

schema.headline: Fox Sees Q1 Revenue Grow, But Higher Expenses Cut Profit

title: Nexstar Extends CEO Perry Sookâ€™s Contract Through 2029
description: Nexstar Media Group, the largest U.S. broadcast TV station group, extended the employment agreement of chairman and CEO Perry Sook through March 31,
body:
Nexstar Media Group, the largest U.S. broadcast TV station group, extended the employment agreement of chairman and CEO Perry Sook through March 31, 2029.

	Sook, who is the companyâ€™s third largest shareholder, oversees Nexstar, which has just over 200 owned or partner stations in 116 U.S. markets. Now Nexstar wants to get even bigger: In August,Â the company announced an agreement to acquire rival station group Tegna, which has 64 stations, for $6.2 billion.
	

	Sook founded Nexstar in 1996 and has served as CEO of the Irving, Texas-based company ever since. During his tenure as chief executive, Sook has led the completion and integration of more than 40 acquisitions. In 2024, he had a compensation package worth $35.9 million (up 23% from the year prior), including stock awards valued at $27.7 million and a $3.2 million cash bonus.


	Nexstar and Sook have also been in the headlines recently over the companyâ€™s decision to pre-empt Jimmy Kimmelâ€™s late-night show on its ABC affiliates, over comments Kimmel made about the MAGA movementâ€™s attempts to score political points from Charlie Kirkâ€™s assassination. With the Tegna deal pending, Nexstarâ€™s decision was seen as an attempt to get in the good graces of FCC Chairman Brendan Carr, who had vigorously criticized Kimmelâ€™s remarks and suggested local TV stations could lose their broadcast licenses if Kimmel were not taken off the air. Nexstarâ€™s acquisition of Tegna would require the FCC to lift the station ownership cap, which allows broadcasters to reach no more than 39% of the national audience.

	Nexstar denied Carrâ€™s threats influenced its decisionÂ to pre-empt Kimmelâ€™s show. Three days after ABC reinstated Kimmel, Nexstar agreed to start airing â€œJimmy Kimmel Live!â€ again (as did Sinclair, which also had boycotted Kimmel over the Kirk remarks). The company said Disney execs were taking a â€œconstructive approach to addressing our concerns.â€ Sook, in a memo to Nexstar staffers written with president/COO Mike Biard, defended Nexstarâ€™s move to pull Kimmelâ€™s show, saying the company was exercising its â€œduty to program in the public interestâ€ as FCC licensees. Sook and Biard also said Nexstarâ€™s blackout of Kimmel wasnâ€™t a First Amendment violation: â€œNo one has an unlimited right to say whatever they want on a talk show.â€
	

	In a statement Thursday, Sook said, â€œAs we embark on this next phase of growth for Nexstar, I have never been more energized about the prospects for the industry, for Nexstar and for what Nexstar can become. I look forward to leading the company to new levels of success and continuing to create value for our shareholders, our advertisers, our employees and the communities we serve.â€

	Jay Grossman, chairman of the Nexstar boardâ€™s compensation committee, commented, â€œThe board is delighted to extend Perryâ€™s employment agreement at this pivotal moment for Nexstar and the local broadcast television industry. Perryâ€™s vision, commitment and deep understanding of the media landscape have been instrumental in driving Nexstarâ€™s strong and consistent record of operating execution, financial growth and shareholder returns.â€

	Nexstar expects the Tegna deal to close in the second half of 2026, pending regulatory approvals. Grossman, commenting on the pending Tegna deal, said, â€œThe proposed acquisition of Tegna represents the next chapter in Nexstarâ€™s growth story and with Perryâ€™s unmatched experience and track record of success in broadcast M&A, he is uniquely qualified to deliver the full value we expect for shareholders, as well as the local communities we serve.â€

	Nexstarâ€™s national television properties include the CW, the U.S.â€™s No. 5 broadcast network, NewsNation, multicast networks Antenna TV and Rewind TV, and a 31.3% ownership stake in TV Food Network. The companyâ€™s digital assets include its local TV station websites, political news outlet The Hill and NewsNationNow.com.

schema.headline: Nexstar Extends CEO Perry Sookâ€™s Contract Through 2029

title: Alicia Vikander, Jamie Dornan, Jodie Turner-Smith, Bill Nighy and Gillian Anderson Set for Animated Fantasy â€˜The Turning Door,â€™ Mister Smith and 2AM Selling at AFM (EXCLUSIVE)
description: A quintet of stars are set to lead the voice cast for â€œThe Turning Door,â€ the newly-announced family fantasy epic being written and directed by film
body:
A quintet of stars are set to lead the voice cast for â€œThe Turning Door,â€ the newly-announced family fantasy epic being written and directed by filmmaker and VFX supervisor Nicholas Ashe Bateman (â€œThe Wanting Mareâ€). 

	Alicia Vikander (â€œFirebrand,â€ â€œThe Danish Girlâ€), Jamie Dornan (â€œBelfastâ€), Jodie Turner-Smith (â€œTron: Aresâ€), Bill Nighy (â€œLivingâ€) and Gillian Anderson (â€œSex Educationâ€) have joined the film, being produced by Christine Dâ€™Souza Gelb of 2AM (â€œBabygirl,â€ â€œPast Livesâ€) with Bateman and Hunter Hall of Maere Studios (â€œAn Almost Christmas Storyâ€). The film will feature original music and songs written by People Museumâ€™s Claire Givens (â€œMother Maryâ€) and Bateman. Production is currently underway.
	

	Mister Smith Entertainment is onboard for international sales and will introduce footage from the film to buyers at the upcoming American Film Market. 2AM is handling North American sales.


	â€œThe Turning Doorâ€ follows a young girl called Ariadlyn, who is sent to bed as a party rages downstairs. Escaping her bedtime, she slips into her parentsâ€™ room, where she discovers an ornate wooden box, opening a door to a magical world called The Turning. To find her way back home and save her parents â€” now frozen in the real world â€” Ariadlyn must seek out a sorceress and her crystal vial. Along the way, she will encounter giants, whales, armies, shapeshifters and acrobatic monkeys as she discovers what it means to grow up.

	The films marks Batemanâ€™s second feature following 2020â€™s critically acclaimed sci-fi fantasy â€œThe Wanting Mare.â€ He is the founder of Maere Studios, the award-winning VFX and animation studio, designing effects for films such as â€œThe Green Knight,â€ â€œOrigin,â€ â€œHocus Pocus 2,â€ â€œMother Mary,â€ â€œPeter Pan and Wendyâ€ and â€œAn Almost Christmas Story.â€
	

	â€œThe pictures, places and songs of â€˜The Turning Doorâ€™ have been with me since I was a child,â€ said Bateman. â€œThematically, its world is a combination of the ones which have filled me with wonder since I was little: the Neverlands, Wonderlands and all those adventures in far-off fantasies. Technically, the film is the result of the past 15 years of trying to make stories â€”Â while developing the tools, the dreams and the incredible artists needed to pursue them. More than ever, itâ€™s important to believe that independent animation made by passionate artists and a dream cast has a place in the world; entirely new cinematic experiences â€” made by people â€” without any generative AI.â€

	Added Mister Smith CEO David Garrett: â€œAnyone with a heart and with an appreciation of the magic of filmmaking cannot help but fall in love with this film. It has the makings of a classic for all audiences for all time.â€

	Mister Smithâ€™s current sales slate includes Mercedes Bryce Morganâ€™s psychosexual thriller/horror â€œBone Lake,â€ Directorsâ€™ Fortnight selection â€œDangerous Animals,â€ Christmas comedy â€œTinsel Town,â€ SXSW Narrative Spotlight selection â€œThe Threesome,â€ magical realist drama â€œThe Accompanist,â€ drama â€œEverybody Digs Bill Evans,â€ action/spy thriller â€œBlake & Mortimer: The Yellow M,â€ supernatural horror thriller â€œHide and Donâ€™t Speakâ€ and faith-based family epic â€œIn the Beginning.â€

schema.headline: Alicia Vikander, Jamie Dornan, Jodie Turner-Smith, Bill Nighy and Gillian Anderson Set for Animated Fantasy â€˜The Turning Door,â€™ Mister Smith and 2AM Selling at AFM (EXCLUSIVE)

title: â€˜Black Money for White Nightsâ€™ Offers â€˜Tragicomic Meditationâ€™ on â€˜Moral Erosionâ€™ at Heart of Post-Communist Bulgarian Life
description: Acclaimed Bulgarian directing duo Kristina Grozeva and Petar Valchanov (â€œThe Fatherâ€) are in post-production on their fifth feature, â€œBlack Money fo
body:
Acclaimed Bulgarian directing duo Kristina Grozeva and Petar Valchanov (â€œThe Fatherâ€) are in post-production on their fifth feature, â€œBlack Money for White Nights,â€ an absurdist tale about a middle-aged couple who lose their life savings in a travel scam. The directors will be presenting the film during the Works in Progress program of the Thessaloniki Film Festivalâ€™s industry arm, Agora, which takes place Nov. 2 â€“ 6.Â 

	â€œBlack Money for White Nightsâ€ is the story of Marina, a maternity nurse, and her husband Gosha, a railway dispatcher, who have spent years collecting small bribes to afford their dream trip to St. Petersburg to witness the White Nights. When Russia invades Ukraine, however, and the travel agency vanishes with their savings, their dream collapses â€” along with any illusions they clung to that they were in control of their lives.
	

	When Gosha winds up in the hospital, after being beaten while trying to recover the coupleâ€™s missing money, long-buried betrayals surface, forcing the couple to finally confront the lies their life was built on. In the end, their misfortune might ultimately present an opportunity to search among the ruins for a trace of dignity and grace.


	Speaking toÂ VarietyÂ ahead of the Thessaloniki Film Festival, Grozeva and Valchanov described â€œBlack Money for White Nightsâ€ as a â€œtragicomic meditation on post-communist life, where moral black and white have switched places.â€ It is a film, they said, â€œborn out of confusion [at] a time when words lost their meaning and moral gravity seemed to collapse.â€
	

	The veteran filmmaking tandem first conceived of the film nearly a decade ago, at a time when Valchanov said they were â€œtaking a little break from the script for â€˜The Father,â€™â€ an odd-couple road-trip comedy about a hapless man struggling to care for his father in the days following his motherâ€™s funeral. The title is a riff on the Bulgarian expression to â€œsave white money for black days,â€ the equivalent of an American rainy-day fund. Eventually the idea had to be shelved as the directors focused on other projects, but â€œwe returned after some years and said, â€˜Ok, this idea still provokes us,â€™â€ Valchanov said.

	In the interim years, â€œThe Fatherâ€ would go on to win the Crystal Globe at the Karlovy Vary Film Festival in 2019, while â€œTriumph,â€ starring Maria Bakalova, would premiere at the Toronto Film Festival in 2024 and be named Bulgariaâ€™s submission for the best international feature Oscar race. Meanwhile, the world was turned upside-down by the coronavirus pandemic, and the global political order was upended by the growing influence of the far right. Then Russian forces invaded Ukraine, putting that very political order to the test.

	In Bulgaria, Grozeva and Valchanov watched with â€œdisbeliefâ€ as the society around them was not only transformed but disfigured, and the very people who lived under the shadow of totalitarian rule were suddenly clamoring to defend the very forces that had enslaved them. The film, said the directors, grew out of that â€œabsurdity,â€ focusing on the â€œquiet moral erosion that hides beneath the surface â€” invisible until one day everything built upon it collapses.â€

	â€œBlack Money for White Nightsâ€ is written by Grozeva, Valchanov, Diana Stoykova and Decho Taralezhkov and produced by Abraxas Film (Bulgaria) in co-production with Graal Films (Greece), with the support of the Bulgarian National Film Center, Eurimages, the Greek Film Center, BNT and ERT. The director of photography is Alexander Stanishev (â€œThe Magic Life of Vâ€), while editing is done by longtime Yorgos Lanthimos collaborator Yorgos Mavropsaridis (â€œThe Favourite,â€ â€œPoor Thingsâ€).

	Though the film presents an unflinching â€œportrait of a generation who was the bearer of change, the bearer of hope for democracyâ€¦[whose] lives are built on mistaken beliefs,â€ Grozeva said the directors sought to portray their characters with sympathy â€” â€œto try to understand, not to judge them or point at their wrongs, but to understandâ€¦[and] get into their shoes.â€Â 
	

	It is when Marina and Goshaâ€™s comfortable lives crumble, after all, that â€œthey are forced to confront their own mistaken beliefs,â€ said Grozeva. Itâ€™s at that moment that perhaps a glimmer of light can creep in.

	â€œThere is hope, and the hope comes when everything falls apart,â€ Grozeva said. â€œWhen lies and delusions collapse completely, maybe thatâ€™s when we open the space for truth and some different kind of order.â€

	The Thessaloniki Film Festival runs Oct. 30 â€“ Nov. 9.

schema.headline: â€˜Black Money for White Nightsâ€™ Offers â€˜Tragicomic Meditationâ€™ on â€˜Moral Erosionâ€™ at Heart of Post-Communist Bulgarian Life

title: Lily Allen Unveils â€˜West End Girlâ€™ U.K. Tour Dates
description:
Lily Allen has announced a slew of tour dates across the U.K. in support of her red-hot new album, â€œWest End Girl.â€

	The English singer-songwriter
body:
Lily Allen has announced a slew of tour dates across the U.K. in support of her red-hot new album, â€œWest End Girl.â€

	The English singer-songwriter made the announcement on Instagram Thursday, nearly a week after the surprise release of her first album since 2018. Taking place in March of next year, the tour includes two dates at the London Palladium and will see Allen perform in theaters in Glasgow, Liverpool, Birmingham, Sheffield, Newcastle, Manchester, Nottingham, Cambridge, Bristol and Cardiff. It marks Allenâ€™s first time touring since 2019.
	

	Tickets go on sale Nov. 7 at 10 a.m. local time, with the sign-up for presale access now live here.


	Allenâ€™s â€œWest End Girlâ€ stirred up buzz after its release on Friday, with the album serving as confirmation that she and her husband, â€œStranger Thingsâ€ actor David Harbour, have split. Though Allen has said in interviews that the album is not to be taken as the full truth of what happened in the relationship, her scathing lyrics on songs such as â€œPussy Palace,â€ â€œSleepwalkingâ€ and â€œMadelineâ€ have both shocked and delighted the internet.

	In Varietyâ€˜s review of the album, chief music critic Chris Willman called â€œWest End Girlâ€ an immediate album of the year contender. â€œItâ€™s the pleasure of listening to a master storyteller who makes your jaw drop by seeming to have spilled all the tea almost at the outset, and then the tea just keeps on coming,â€ Willman wrote. â€œNot since Boston in 1773, maybe, has anyone dumped it this massively, or this fulfillingly.â€

	See all the info about Allenâ€™s â€œWest End Girlâ€ U.K. tour below.

schema.headline: Lily Allen Unveils â€˜West End Girlâ€™ U.K. Tour Dates

title: Matilda De Angelis on Playing a Vampire in Luc Bessonâ€™s â€˜Draculaâ€™ and How Her Cat Inspired Her Character: â€˜Theyâ€™re Cuddling, and Then the Next Moment They Bite Youâ€™
description: You could say Italian actress Matilda De Angelis was fated to work with French film director Luc Besson as she was named after a character from a Be
body:
You could say Italian actress Matilda De Angelis was fated to work with French film director Luc Besson as she was named after a character from a Besson film.




	â€œItâ€™s true,â€ she says talking to Variety on the occasion of â€œDracula: A Love Taleâ€ screening at Lucca Comics and Games in Lucca, Italy. â€My mom and my dad went to see â€˜Leonâ€™ in 94 and they came out of the movie, and they loved it, loved it, loved it, and they loved the character of Natalie Portman. And they decided if their baby was a boy, he was going to be Leon and if it was a girl, she was going to be Matilda. So here I am.â€
	

	She saw the film herself when she was 13 years old. â€œI was happy to hear that I was named after her. And I fell in love with the character. I fell in love with Bessonâ€™s movies in general. Then I saw â€˜The Fifth Element,â€™ and then â€˜Valerianâ€™ and â€˜Arthurâ€™ and â€˜Lucy,â€™ and then I grew to be fan of his work.â€




	

					Dracula: A Love Tale
									Courtesy of EuropaCorp, TF1 Films Production, SND/Shanna Besson
	



	The star, best known for her starring roles in the Netflix show â€œThe Law According to Lidia PoÃ«tâ€ and the Amazon show â€œCitadel: Diana,â€ first met Besson over a Zoom call. â€œWe talked about everything but the movie,â€ she says. â€œIt was more getting to know each other, and we talked about what we like, what we donâ€™t like; and then he told me about the movie and the character.â€

	In the film she plays Maria, a society lady who has been turned into a vampire by Count Dracula played by Caleb Landry Jones. Oscar winner Christoph Waltz plays Van Helsing. â€œLuc wanted Maria to be very unpredictable. He told me, I need tons of mood changes in one scene, from laughing to crying and laughing and crying at the same time. Sheâ€™s like an animal at one moment, sheâ€™s like a cat, pawing and crying and trying to seduce the priest, and the moment after, sheâ€™s like a beast, sheâ€™s like a tiger and ready to attack. I studied my cat. Cats are a bit crazy. Theyâ€™re cuddling, and then the next moment, they bite you, and they do it with the same sweetness and the ferocity at the same time.
	



	

					â€œDracula: A Love Taleâ€
									Courtesy of EuropaCorp, TF1 Films Production, SND/Shanna Besson
	



	â€œAnd I knew I was opposite Christoph Waltz, who is one of my favorite actors of all time. And I knew Caleb Landry Jones was playing Dracula. So, I knew the stakes were high and the challenge was hard, but it made me feel important. It made me feel great, you know, good, challenging.â€

	Itâ€™s not the first time De Angelis has been part of an international ensemble. Having made an impression in her native Italy with award winning turns in films such as â€œItalian Raceâ€ and â€œRose Island,â€ she was cast in the HBO miniseries â€œThe Undoing,â€ where she starred alongside Nicole Kidman and Hugh Grant as well as starring in the adaptation of the Ernest Hemingway novel â€œAcross the River and Into the Trees,â€ alongside Liev Schreiber and Josh Hutcherson.



	

					â€œDracula: A Love Taleâ€
									Courtesy of EuropaCorp, TF1 Films Production, SND/Shanna Besson
	



	However, she is in no hurry to set up her next project. â€œActually, I want to study my next moves. I donâ€™t want to just binge-eat everything that comes. Iâ€™m ready to work more abroad and outside of Italy. It would be my dream right now. Iâ€™m waiting for the next good character for me.â€

	Following her appearance at Lucca Comic and Games with Luc Besson, she will be seen next in Mario Martoneâ€™s film â€œFuori,â€ which premiered at Cannes earlier this year and is set to be released in France on Dec. 3. â€œWorking in France would be one of my dreams right now. And Iâ€™m happy the film will be released there.â€



	

									Courtesy of Lucia Iorio

schema.headline: Matilda De Angelis on Playing a Vampire in Luc Bessonâ€™s â€˜Draculaâ€™ and How Her Cat Inspired Her Character: â€˜Theyâ€™re Cuddling, and Then the Next Moment They Bite Youâ€™

title: 'Fresh Prince of Bel Air' Child Actor Floyd Roger Myers Jr. Dead at 42
description:
'Fresh Prince of Bel Air' Child Star
                          Floyd Roger Myers Jr. Dead at 42
body:
'Fresh Prince of Bel Air' Child Star
                          Floyd Roger Myers Jr. Dead at 42
                      
                  
                        Published October 29, 2025 7:08 PM PDT
                                                                      |
                Updated October 30, 2025 5:12 AM PDT
                                    
      
    
      
        
              
    
    
          Floyd Roger Myers Jr. -- a former child actor best known for his role in the "Fresh Prince of Bel-Air" -- has died ... TMZ has learned.
      
    
          His mom, Renee Trice tells TMZ â€¦ Myers passed away in the wee hours of Wednesday morning from a heart attack at his home in Maryland. She tells us he suffered 3 prior heart attacks over the course of the last three years. She says she just spoke to her son last night.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          Floyd kicked off his career as a younger version of Will Smith in the hit sitcom "The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air" ... before taking on the role as a young Marlon Jackson in the television miniseries "The Jacksons: An American Dream."
      
    
          Myers had a part in one episode of the short-lived TV drama "Young Americans" in 2000.
      
    
          Floyd was 42.
      
    
          RIP

title: Producer Gets 146 Years for Drug Overdose Deaths of Model & Her Friend
description:
Hollywood Producer
                          146 Years in Prison
                          For Druggin
body:
Hollywood Producer
                          146 Years in Prison
                          For Drugging, Raping, Murdering Women
                      
                  
                        Published October 29, 2025 2:22 PM PDT
                                                                            
              
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Hollywood producer and serial rapist David Brian Pearce was sentenced to 146 years to life in prison Wednesday for the tragic drug overdose deaths of a model and her friend ... in addition to other heinous convictions.
      
    
          Pearce was convicted of murdering 24-year-old Christy Giles and her 26-year-old friend Hilda Marcela Cabrales-Arzola in the first degree back in February. According to ABC7 Los Angeles, further investigation also uncovered rapes he committed against several women over more than a decade -- he was also convicted of multiple counts including forcible rape, sexual penetration by use of force, rape of an unconscious person, and sodomy by use of force.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Prosecutors said Pearce reportedly met Giles and Cabrales-Arzola at an after-hours rave and later drugged them to facilitate a sexual assault.
      

          The details of Giles' and Cabrales-Arzola's last moments are disturbing. On November 13, 2021, Giles -- a model and aspiring actress -- was already dead when she was taken to Southern California Hospital at Culver City in the L.A. area, ABC7 reports.
      
    
          Cabrales-Arzola -- an architect -- was in critical condition when she arrived at Kaiser Permanente West Los Angeles Hospital. Her heartbroken family made the difficult decision to take her off life support later that month.
      
    
          Prosecutors told jurors Pearce and co-defendant Brandt Walter Osborn were the ones who dropped the women off at the respective hospitals 2 hours apart ... after they overdosed at the apartment the men shared.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          Giles reportedly died of a lethal mix of cocaine, fentanyl, gamma-hydroxybutyric acid, and ketamine ... while Cabrales-Arzola died of multiple organ failure, with cocaine, ecstasy, and other undetermined drugs found in her system.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          Pearce reportedly denied giving them the drugs that killed them, but after two and half days of deliberation, the jury decided they weren't buying it.
      
    
          Osborn, 46 -- who was facing 2 counts of being an accessory after the fact -- is awaiting a potential retrial after jurors said they were deadlocked over his verdict.
      
    
          Giles' mother, Dusty, reportedly said she was "so proud" of the prosecution for winning the case, and happy that Pearce's sexual assault victims "finally had their day in court" too.

schema.headline: Producer Gets 146 Years for Drug Overdose Deaths of Model & Her Friend
